com.cse3111project.bot.spring.category

Class Category

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cse3111project.bot.spring.category.Category
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Academic, Campus, Function, Instruction, Social, Transport

    public class Category
extends java.lang.Object
    The Category Class classify different features of the chatbot into different categories, act as the framework of classes of features like Transport and Academic. It coordinates the communication between SearchEngine and different features.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Category analyze(java.util.List<java.lang.String> matchedResults)
      This method will compare the keywords of user query and the pre-defined keywords of different classes, perform further analyzes and determine which category the user is questioning for
      java.lang.String getDataFromSQL()
      This method is intended to be overriden by class who implements StaticAccessible, which is used to get data from SQL database if there is any.
      java.lang.String getDataFromStatic()
      This method is intended to be overriden by class who implements StaticAccessible, which is used to get data from static database if there is any.
      protected java.lang.String replyResults()
      This method will take no parameter and just call the toString() method of the class who invoke this method to get a single string of query-result.
      protected java.lang.String replyResults(java.util.List<?> results)
      This method will take an ArrayList of query result and transform it into a single String by looping through the list and append each elements to the final display result string.

    • Method Detail

      • analyze

        public static Category analyze(java.util.List<java.lang.String> matchedResults)
                        throws AmbiguousQueryException,
                               StaffNotFoundException,
                               CourseNotFoundException,
                               RoomNotFoundException,
                               java.net.MalformedURLException,
                               java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                               java.io.IOException
        This method will compare the keywords of user query and the pre-defined keywords of different classes, perform further analyzes and determine which category the user is questioning for
        Parameters:
        matchedResults -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        AmbiguousQueryException - Throws exception upon unclear user-query.
        StaffNotFoundException - Throws exception when the user is asking for details of UST staffs but there is no matching results.
        RoomNotFoundException - Throws exception when the user is asking for estimated time to go from one place to another place within campus, but the room is invalid.
        java.net.MalformedURLException - Throws exeception when URL has malform problem.
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - Throws exception when static database cannot be loaded.
        java.io.IOException
        CourseNotFoundException

      • getDataFromSQL

        public java.lang.String getDataFromSQL()
                                throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method is intended to be overriden by class who implements StaticAccessible, which is used to get data from SQL database if there is any.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - Throws throwable that indicates this function cannot be used.

      • getDataFromStatic

        public java.lang.String getDataFromStatic()
                                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        This method is intended to be overriden by class who implements StaticAccessible, which is used to get data from static database if there is any.
        Returns:
        String This method will return the query result from static database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - Throws throwable that indicates this function cannot be used.

      • replyResults

        protected java.lang.String replyResults(java.util.List<?> results)
        This method will take an ArrayList of query result and transform it into a single String by looping through the list and append each elements to the final display result string.
        Returns:
        String This method will return a single String which is the actual output to the screen of LINE client.

      • replyResults

        protected java.lang.String replyResults()
        This method will take no parameter and just call the toString() method of the class who invoke this method to get a single string of query-result.
        Returns:
        String This method will return a single String which is the actual output to the screen of LINE client.
